lines.text: How do you go about killing a machine?
A machine? It's too heavy to hang and it's too big to put in the gas chamber.
The truth is, we don't know anything for a fact.
Except that bulldozer kills.
That's good enough for me.
What about this slope? Do you think the D9er can get up it?
Given time, it can make a road anywhere it wants to go.
Never have anything you care about, travel light, and travel alone.
The D9er was operating by itself when it ran him down. Throttling. Pivoting. Floating the blade.
How?
I don't know how.
What's the matter Kelly? You always used to knew when to bear down and when to ease up
Look I'm only human.
Well then remember, we are too.
[finding an old photograph]
Veronica Lake.
What?
Not what, man! Who! This is Veronica Lake. Didn't you ever hear of Veronica Lake? I wanna tell ya somethin'. This chick was cool before they invented the word.
Okay, sweetheart! Destroy!
[the D9 can't budge a strange rock]
What's the matter, won't it come out?
Nah, this funny lookin' rock here.
Yeah, it's metallic. Doesn't match the geological formation.
Maybe we've uncovered Captain Kidd's treasure.
Well, whatever it is, it's gonna have to come out.
You sound like the dentist.
The D9er's harmless now. It's outta fuel, racked up there somewhere, so we leave it be and let the company engineers come in and find the bugs in it later.
And if you're wrong?
Tomorrow's gonna be another tough day.

Remote control. That's got to be it. That thing is runnin' by remote control. Listen. Listen, you guys. We gotta do something. I mean, something's wrong. Machine's just don't run by themselves. That means there's somebody else on this island. You know, foreign spies or something.
How 'bout a mad scientist?
[the Killdozer lurks on a cliff]
Can you believe that thing? What's it waiting for?
What's its hurry?
